job.job_description: Job Posting Title:Content Research Insights & Analytics Intern, Summer/Fall 2026Req ID:10138487Job Description:About the Role & Program: The Disney Entertainment Research, Insights, and Analytics team is searching for a motivated television enthusiast who is interested in using data to tell stories. You will be part of a team that provides insights using data and analytics to help support executives in their decision making. A distinguishing characteristic of the internship is the ability to work hands-on with real data and relay that information to all departments across Disney Entertainment and several within the larger Walt Disney Company.                            This internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in Burbank, CA from June 2026-January 2027. What You Will Do: You will be guided by a team dedicated to ensuring you are properly taught, have the required access and software/tools, and gain the experience necessary to pursue a future career in data and analytics in the television industry. You will:  Gain hands-on experience reporting on key trends in the television industry and program viewership Learn Nielsen and other software and business intelligence tools to report on program performance Expand your technical skills (e.g. Excel, Looker, Alteryx, Tableau, etc.) Discuss the changing television landscape with experienced industry professionals Work with U.S. and Global Streaming data to contextualize streaming performance Assist in creating and maintaining ratings reports, analyses, and presentations  Use internal and external analytics tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate data Required Qualifications & Skills: The ideal candidate would have a passion for all forms of television content  Proficiency with Excel – including lookups, arrays, and logic formulasProficiency with PowerPoint and OutlookExperience or knowledge of SQL and cloud-based data warehousesOutstanding communication skills – written, oral, presentation, and storytelling Curiosity and passion for solving problems and answering challenging questions  Ability to be flexible, adapt to changing priorities, and able to juggle multiple projects Extraordinarily organized and detail oriented   Preferred Qualifications: Experience with Looker, Tableau, Alteryx or other BI technologies Presentation graphics ability is a plus (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) Experience working with large files/datasets Education: Junior or Senior year preferredMajor or previous coursework in Information Systems, Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related major is preferred Optional Materials:Candidates may choose to submit a writing sample that highlights an analytical project they completed as part of their application.Eligibility Requirements & Program Information Candidates for this opportunity MUST meet all of the below requirements: Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship. Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program. Be at least 18 years of age.Possess unrestricted work authorization. Additional Information This internship is a full-time, six-month commitment in Burbank, CA from June 2026-January 2027 Able to have a consistent, reliable work schedule throughout the internship Fully available Monday through Friday for the duration of the internship, 40 hours each week Able to provide own housing for the duration of the internship program in the Burbank, CA area Able to provide reliable transportation to/from work in the Burbank, CA area. Recommendation – Print This Role Description: We encourage applicants to print a copy of this role description so they can refer to it in the event they are selected for an interview. Note that this role description will not be accessible once the posting is closed.The pay rate for this role in California is $22.50 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.Job Posting Segment:Disney NetworksJob Posting Primary Business:Disney Networks AllPrimary Job Posting Category:Data Science and Analytics Intern, Other, Research and Development InternEmployment Type:Full timePrimary City, State, Region, Postal Code:Burbank, CA, USAAlternate City, State, Region, Postal Code:Date Posted:2026-02-02
